claim.body: switching, by the telecommunications system, the inbound fax call to a call mediation system further comprises performing round-robin load balancing among the plurality of call mediation systems.
claim.claim-text: 2. The method of claim 1 , wherein said switching, by the telecommunications system, the inbound fax call to a call mediation system further comprises performing round-robin load balancing among the plurality of call mediation systems.

claim.body: the plurality of call mediation systems comprise a plurality of private branch exchanges (PBXs), wherein said switching, by the telecommunications system, the inbound fax call to a call mediation system comprises switching the inbound fax call to a PBX of the plurality of PBXs and wherein said switching, by the call mediation system, the inbound fax call to a selected fax processing resource comprises calling a digital access cross connect system (DACS) logically interposed between the PBX and the fax processing resource.
claim.claim-text: 3. The method of claim 2 , wherein the plurality of call mediation systems comprise a plurality of private branch exchanges (PBXs), wherein said switching, by the telecommunications system, the inbound fax call to a call mediation system comprises switching the inbound fax call to a PBX of the plurality of PBXs and wherein said switching, by the call mediation system, the inbound fax call to a selected fax processing resource comprises calling a digital access cross connect system (DACS) logically interposed between the PBX and the fax processing resource.

claim.body: a decision, by the PBX switch, whether to accept or reject the inbound fax call based on one or more of the source address, the destination address and a specific circuit or packet switched connection through which the inbound fax call was received.
claim.transPhrase: , further comprising prior to said determining, making
claim.claim-text: 4. The method of claim 3 , further comprising prior to said determining, making a decision, by the PBX switch, whether to accept or reject the inbound fax call based on one or more of the source address, the destination address and a specific circuit or packet switched connection through which the inbound fax call was received.

claim.body: the PBX remaining in a call path of the inbound fax call until completion of the inbound fax call and upon the completion the PBX recording billing information in a database.
claim.claim-text: 5. The method of claim 4 , further comprising the PBX remaining in a call path of the inbound fax call until completion of the inbound fax call and upon the completion the PBX recording billing information in a database.

claim.body: a delivery method to employ in connection with delivery of the digital representation to the one or more users based on the destination address or user account specific preferences associated with the one or more users.
claim.claim-text: 6. The method of claim 1 , further comprising determining a delivery method to employ in connection with delivery of the digital representation to the one or more users based on the destination address or user account specific preferences associated with the one or more users.

claim.body: the determined delivery method is electronic mail (email) delivery.
claim.claim-text: 7. The method of claim 6 , wherein the determined delivery method is electronic mail (email) delivery.

claim.body: the determined delivery method is delivery via an application programming interface (API) associated with the Internet fax system.
claim.claim-text: 9. The method of claim 6 , wherein the determined delivery method is delivery via an application programming interface (API) associated with the Internet fax system.

claim.body: the API supports programmatic listing of a plurality of received faxes and programmatic downloading of a received fax of the plurality of received faxes.

claim.body: a web services interface of the Internet fax system a Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) or a HTTP secure (HTTPS) POST generated by an application of the subscriber that conveys a request for retrieval of a particular received fax.
